sen.j: 美濃王（みののおおきみ、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
Mino no Okimi (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
Mino no Okimi (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「みののおほきみ」。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name is called "Mino no Ohokimi".
In old Japanese syllabary characters, he is called "Mino no Ohokimi".
sen.cmt: こちらのほうが、自然な表現だと思い訂正しました。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, he is called "Mino no Ohokimi".

sen.j: 御野王、三野王、弥努王、美努王はいずれも同音。
sen.e: 御野王、三野王、弥努王、美努王 are all pronounced the same.
御野王、三野王、弥努王、美努王 are all pronounced the same.
御野王、三野王、弥努王、美努王 are all pronounced the same.

sen.j: 皇族だが系譜は不明。
sen.e: He was a member of the Imperial family, but his lineage record is unknown.
He was a member of the Imperial family, but his pedigree record is unknown.
sen.cmt: lineage record ⇒ 指定されている単語pedigree recordに変更しました。
sen.e: He was a member of the Imperial family, but his pedigree record is unknown.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）に味方し、天武朝の皇親政治の一翼を担った。
sen.e: He supported Prince Oama during the Jinshin war in 672 and played a role in pro-imperial family politics during the Reign of Emperor Tenmu.
He supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin war in 672 and played a role in pro-imperial family politics during the Reign of Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ (Emperor Tenmu) に対応しました。
sen.e: He supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin war in 672 and played a role in pro-imperial family politics during the Reign of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 同時代に壬申の乱で中立を保った同名の美努王がおり、文献に出る「みののおおきみ」のどれが誰なのかについて諸説ある。
sen.e: During the same period, there was another Mino no Okimi (美努王),(different characters with same pronunciation), who maintained neutral during the Jinshin war, but different theories reported various views where Mino no Okimi was mentioned in documentary records.

During the same period, there was another Mino no Okimi (美努王) (different characters with same pronunciation) who maintained neutrality during the Jinshin war, and there are various theories as to "Mino no Okimi" appeared in documentary records about who is who.

During the same period, there was another person with the name Mino no Okimi (the name of the Mino no Okimi that is the subject of this article is written in Japanese kanji as 美濃王, while that of the other Mino no Okimi is written as 美努王) who remained neutral during the Jinshin war, and opinions vary as to which "Mino no Okimi" is referred to in the various documentary records of that time.
sen.cmt: (different→(different（余分な空白を削除しました）

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、吉野宮にいた大海人皇子は兵力を持たず、使いをたてて東国で兵を集めさせつつそちらに向かった。
sen.e: When the Jinshin war started, Prince Oama who was in Yoshino no miya palace, didn't have any armed forces, so the Prince first sent envoys to take up arms in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and headed in that direction.

When the Jinshin war broke out, Prince Oama who was in Yoshino no miya palace, didn't have any armed forces, so the Prince first sent envoys to take up arms in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and headed for that direction.
sen.cmt: started ⇒ broke out headed in ⇒ headed for に訂正しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin war broke out, Prince Oama who was in Yoshino no miya palace, didn't have any armed forces, so the Prince first sent envoys to take up arms in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) and headed for that direction.

sen.j: 莬田（大和国宇陀郡）で美濃王を呼び出したところ、美濃王は一行に従った。
sen.e: Prince Oama summoned Mino no Okimi to Toda (Uda-gun, Yamato Province) and Mino no Okimi agreed to join the prince's party.
Prince Oama summoned Mino no Okimi to Toda (Uda-gun, Yamato Province) and Mino no Okimi agreed to join the prince's party.
Prince Oama summoned Mino no Okimi to Toda (Uda-gun, Yamato Province) and Mino no Okimi agreed to join the prince's party.

sen.j: その後の内戦での美濃王の行動については記録がない。
sen.e: No records were found about Mino no Okimi's acts in the domestic warfare afterwards.
No records were found about Mino no Okimi's acts in the domestic warfare afterwards.
No records were found about Mino no Okimi's acts in the domestic warfare afterwards.

sen.j: 天武天皇2年（673年）12月17日に、美濃王は紀訶多麻呂とともに造高市大寺司に任じられた。
sen.e: On February 1, 674, Mino no Okimi was appointed as an Officer of Takechi-daiji Temple Construction together with Ki no Katamaro.
On February 1, 674, Mino no Okimi was appointed as an Officer of Takechi-daiji Temple Construction together with Ki no Katamaro.
On February 1, 674, Mino no Okimi was appointed as an Officer of Takechi-daiji Temple Construction together with Ki no Katamaro.

sen.j: 高市大寺は大安寺の前身である。
sen.e: Takechi-daiji Temple was previously Daian-ji Temple.
Takechi-daiji Temple was the predecessor of Daian-ji Temple.
Takechi-daiji Temple was the predecessor of Daian-ji Temple.

sen.j: 美濃王の冠位はこのとき小紫であった。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi's rank was shoshi (which corresponds to Jusanmi, Junior Third Rank of Taiho Code) at this time.
Mino no Okimi's rank was shoshi (which corresponds to Jusanmi, Junior Third Rank of Taiho Code) at this time.
Mino no Okimi's rank was shoshi (which corresponds to Jusanmi, Junior Third Rank of Taiho Code) at this time.

sen.j: 「大安寺伽藍縁起并流記資財帳」では御野王と記される。
sen.e: "Daianji Garan Ruki narabini Shizaucho" (The History of Daian-ji Temple and the record of the estates) recorded his name "御野王" (Mino no Okimi).
His name is recorded as "御野王" (Mino no Okimi) in "Daianji Garan Ruki narabini Shizaucho" (The History of Daian-ji Temple and the record of the estates).
sen.cmt: 日本語に忠実かつ自然な表現になると思い訂正しました。
sen.e: His name is recorded as "御野王" (Mino no Okimi) in "Daianji Garan Ruki narabini Shizaucho" (The History of Daian-ji Temple and the record of the estates).

sen.j: 天武天皇4年（675年）4月10日に、美濃王は佐伯広足とともに遣わされて竜田の立野で風神を祀った。
sen.e: On May 12, 675, Mino no Okimi and SAEKI no Hirotarii were dispatched to worship the god of the wind in Tateno, Tatsuta.
On May 12, 675, Mino no Okimi was dispatched to worship the god of the wind in Tateno, Tatsuta with SAEKI no Hirotarii.
sen.cmt: 文の並びを日本語のとおりに訂正しました。
sen.e: On May 12, 675, Mino no Okimi was dispatched to worship the god of the wind in Tateno, Tatsuta with SAEKI no Hirotarii.

sen.j: 現代の地名では奈良県三郷町立野にあたる。
sen.e: Currently it is in Sango-cho, Nara Prefecture.
Currently it is in Sango-cho, Tateno, Nara Prefecture.
Currently it is in Sango-cho, Tateno, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 天武朝では、竜田風神と広瀬大忌神の祭りは『日本書紀』に連年記録された重要な祭祀で、その初見がこの年のものである。
sen.e: In the Reign of Emperor Tenmu, two festivals worshipping Tatsuta wind god and Hirose no ohoimi no kami (広瀬大忌神) were very important and reported in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) every year, and the first appearance e of such festivals was in the year 675.

In the Reign of Emperor Tenmu, two festivals worshipping Tatsuta wind god and Hirose no ohoimi no kami (広瀬大忌神) were very important and recorded in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) every year, and the first appearance of these festivals were in the year 675.
sen.cmt: reported ⇒recorded e ⇒ 削除 such ⇒ these
sen.e: In the Reign of Emperor Tenmu, two festivals worshipping Tatsuta wind god and Hirose no ohoimi no kami (広瀬大忌神) were very important and recorded in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) every year, and the first appearance of these festivals were in the year 675.

sen.j: 今竜田大社でなされる風鎮祭の初見でもある。
sen.e: The first appearance of Fuchin festival (festival for appease the anger of the god of wind) (風鎮際) taking place in Tatsuta-taisha Shrine currently.
This is also the first appearance of Fuchin festival (festival for appeasing the anger of the god the god of wind) (風鎮祭) which was taken place in Tatsuta-taisya today.
sen.cmt: 文の構造がおかしかったので、訂正しました。「今」の訳漏れのため加えました。
sen.e: This is also the first appearance of Fuchin festival (festival for appeasing the anger of the god the god of wind) (風鎮祭) which was taken place in Tatsuta-taisya today.

sen.j: 美濃王の冠位はこのときも小紫であった。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi's rank was also shoshi at that time.
Mino no Okimi's rank was still shoshi at that time.
Mino no Okimi's rank was still shoshi at that time.

sen.j: 天武天皇10年（681年）3月17日に、天皇は帝紀と上古の諸事を記録、確定させた。
sen.e: On April 13, 681, Emperor recorded and decided the genealogy of the imperial family and various matters in the ancient period.
On April 13, 681, Emperor recorded and decided the genealogy of the imperial family and various matters in the ancient period.
On April 13, 681, Emperor recorded and decided the genealogy of the imperial family and various matters in the ancient period.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』編纂の始まりとされる。
sen.e: It is viewed as the beginning of the compilations of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
It is viewed as the beginning of the compilations of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
It is viewed as the beginning of the compilations of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: その詔を受けたのは、川島皇子、忍壁皇子、広瀬王、竹田王、桑田王、三野王、上毛野三千、忌部子人、安曇稲敷、難波大形、中臣大島、平群子首であった。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kawashima Osakabe no Miko, Hirose no Okimi, Takeda no Okimi, Kuwata no Okimi, Mino no Okimi, KAMITSUKENU no Michi, INBE no Kobito, AZUMI no Inashiki (安曇稲敷), NANBA no Okata (難波大形), NAKATOMI no Oshima and HEGURI no Koobito received imperial decrees.

Imperial Prince Kawashima Osakabe no Miko, Hirose no Okimi, Takeda no Okimi, Kuwata no Okimi, Mino no Okimi, KAMITSUKENU no Michi, INBE no Kobito, AZUMI no Inashiki (安曇稲敷), NANBA no Okata (難波大形), NAKATOMI no Oshima and HEGURI no Koobito received imperial decrees.

Imperial Prince Kawashima Osakabe no Miko, Hirose no Okimi, Takeda no Okimi, Kuwata no Okimi, Mino no Okimi, KAMITSUKENU no Michi, INBE no Kobito, AZUMI no Inashiki (安曇稲敷), NANBA no Okata (難波大形), NAKATOMI no Oshima and HEGURI no Koobito received imperial decrees.

sen.j: 天武天皇はその治世の間、新しい都を作ることを目的にたびたび臣下を調査に派遣した。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu dispatched his vassals to various cities to investigate the potential building of a new capital during his reign.
Emperor Tenmu often dispatched his vassals to various cities to investigate with a view to construct new capital during his reign.
sen.cmt: たびたび⇒often をつけ加えました。 the potential building of を削除し、with a a view to に変えました。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu often dispatched his vassals to various cities to investigate with a view to construct new capital during his reign.

sen.j: 三野王もそのうちにあり、11年（682年）3月1日に宮内官の大夫たちとともに新城に行って地形を見るよう命じられた。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi was sent to Shinshiro (新城) together with a chief of the office of the Imperial palace to investigate topography on April 16, 682.
Mino no Okimi was one of the member of investigation group and ordered to go to Shinshiro (新城) together with a chief of the office of the Imperial palace to investigate topography on April 16, 682.
sen.cmt: 英訳が日本文に忠実でないため、訂正しました。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi was one of the member of investigation group and ordered to go to Shinshiro (新城) together with a chief of the office of the Imperial palace to investigate topography on April 16, 682.

sen.j: 13年（684年）の2月28日には、采女筑羅とともに信濃国に遣わされ、地形を見るよう命じられた。
sen.e: On March 22, 684, he was sent to Shinano province with UNEME no Chikura to investigate topography.
On March 22, 684, he was sent to Shinano province with UNEME no Chikura and ordered to investigate topography.
sen.cmt: 命じられた⇒was ordered to を付け加えました。
sen.e: On March 22, 684, he was sent to Shinano province with UNEME no Chikura and ordered to investigate topography.

sen.j: 帰ってきた三野王は、閏4月11日に信濃国の図を提出した。
sen.e: Mino no Okimi on returning from Shinano province submitted a drawing of Shinano on July 1, 684.
After returning from Shinano province, Mino no Okimi submitted a drawing of Shinano Province on July 1, 684.
sen.cmt: on returning from を after returning from に変更しました。
sen.e: After returning from Shinano province, Mino no Okimi submitted a drawing of Shinano Province on July 1, 684.

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（683年）9月11日に、天皇は宮処王、広瀬王、難波王、竹田王、弥努王を京と畿内に遣わして、人々の武器を検査した。
sen.e: On October 17, 685, Emperor Tenmu dispatched Miyako no Okimi (宮処王), Hirose no Okimi, Naniwa no oji, Takeda no Okimi and Minu no Okimi to the capital and Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) to inspect arms people owned.

On October 17, 685, Emperor Tenmu dispatched Miyako no Okimi (宮処王), Hirose no Okimi, Naniwa no oji, Takeda no Okimi and Minu no Okimi to the capital and Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) to inspect arms people owned.

On October 17, 685, Emperor Tenmu dispatched Miyako no Okimi (宮処王), Hirose no Okimi, Naniwa no oji, Takeda no Okimi and Minu no Okimi to the capital and Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) to inspect arms people owned.

sen.j: 持統天皇8年（694年）9月22日に、浄広肆三野王は筑紫大宰率に任命された。
sen.e: On October 19, 694, jokoshi (another one of four grades of joi, ranks of the Imperial Princes and Shoo, princes without imperial proclamation of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) Mino no Okimi was assigned to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa no Kami (General of diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys)

On October 19, 694, jokoshi (another one of four grades of joi, ranks of the Imperial Princes and Shoo, princes without imperial proclamation of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) Mino no Okimi was assigned to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa no Kami (General of diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys)

On October 19, 694, jokoshi (another one of four grades of joi, ranks of the Imperial Princes and Shoo, princes without imperial proclamation of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) Mino no Okimi was assigned to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa no Kami (General of diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys)

tit.j: 美濃王・三野王・弥努王・美努王
tit.e: 美濃王・三野王・弥努王・美努王 (all pronounced "Mino no Okimi)
美濃王・三野王・弥努王・美努王 (all pronounced "Mino no Okimi)
美濃王・三野王・弥努王・美努王 (all pronounced "Mino no Okimi)

sen.j: 『日本書紀』で同じ読みができる同時代人には、美濃王・三野王・弥努王・美努王がある。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), 美濃王, 三野王, 弥努王 and 美努王 were all pronounced Mino no Okimi and lived in the same period.
According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), 美濃王, 三野王, 弥努王 and 美努王 were all pronounced Mino no Okimi and lived in the same period.
According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), 美濃王, 三野王, 弥努王 and 美努王 were all pronounced Mino no Okimi and lived in the same period.

sen.j: 同一人物の文字をたがえることは、書紀の中でよくあるし、古くは美濃国は三野とも御野とも書いた。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki", sometimes the same person is written in different characters and Mino Province (美濃国) was also written "三野" or "御野" in ancient time.
In "Nihonshoki", name of the same person is written in different kanji characters and Mino Province (美濃国) was also written "三野" or "御野" in ancient time.
sen.cmt: よりわかりやすくするために、name や kanji を加えました。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki", name of the same person is written in different kanji characters and Mino Province (美濃国) was also written "三野" or "御野" in ancient time.

sen.j: 書紀にはところどころ古い語を編纂時点の語に置き換えた箇所があるので、美濃王と三野王らは同名の人物である。
sen.e: 美濃王 and 三野王 are different persons with the same name since Nihonshoki replaced old words to words used at the time of compilation in places.
Since there are some parts that old words were replaced by words used at the time of compilation in "Nihonshoki," 美濃王 and 三野王 are different persons with the same name.
sen.cmt: 日本書記を主語にするのは不自然だと思い、語句のならびを変えました。
sen.e: Since there are some parts that old words were replaced by words used at the time of compilation in "Nihonshoki," 美濃王 and 三野王 are different persons with the same name.

sen.j: 同名でも同一人と言えないのは、壬申の乱で別に筑紫大宰の栗隈王の子として三野王が登場するからである。
sen.e: A reason 美濃王 and 三野王 was a different person was that 三野王 appeared as a son of Kurikuma no okimi, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (a diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys) in the Jinshin war.

The reason why 美濃王 and 三野王 were different person was that 三野王 appeared as a son of Kurikuma no okimi, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (a diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys) in the Jinshin war.
sen.cmt: 文法的な誤りがみられたので訂正しました。
sen.e: The reason why 美濃王 and 三野王 were different person was that 三野王 appeared as a son of Kurikuma no okimi, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (a diplomatic facility to entertain foreign envoys) in the Jinshin war.

sen.j: 三野王は中立を保つ父とともに筑紫国にあり、距離が離れ態度が異なるので美濃王とは明らかに別人である。
sen.e: 三野王 was in Tsukushi province with his father who maintained neutrality, where he was in the Jinshin war was far away from where 美濃王 was, that's why 美濃王 and 三野王 was obviously different people.
三野王 was in Tsukushi province with his father who maintained neutrality, where he was in the Jinshin war was far away from where 美濃王 was, that's why 美濃王 and 三野王 were obviously different people.
三野王 was in Tsukushi province with his father who maintained neutrality, where he was in the Jinshin war was far away from where 美濃王 was, that's why 美濃王 and 三野王 were obviously different people.

sen.j: しかしその後に入り乱れる同名の人物群を両人にどう振り分けるかについては、確実な手がかりがない。
sen.e: However, there is no certain evidence proving who was who in a group of the same name afterwards.
However, there is no certain evidence proving who was who in a group of the same name afterwards.
However, there is no certain evidence proving who was who in a group of the same name afterwards.

sen.j: 上記の「事績」に記した中では、日本書紀編纂から筑紫大宰までの各々について、どちらの人物を指すのか説が分かれている。
sen.e: There are different views for which Mino no Okimi made the abovementioned achievements from Nihonshoki compilation to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa.
There are different views for which Mino no Okimi made the abovementioned achievements from Nihonshoki compilation to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa.
There are different views for which Mino no Okimi made the abovementioned achievements from Nihonshoki compilation to Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa.

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）以降に現れる人については、栗隈王の子とすることで一致がある。
sen.e: Authorities agree that Mino no Okimi who appeared after year 701 was the son of Kurikuma no Okimi.
Authorities agree that Mino no Okimi who appeared after year 701 was the son of Kurikuma no Okimi.
Authorities agree that Mino no Okimi who appeared after year 701 was the son of Kurikuma no Okimi.
